data.title: Broke Ben
data.statement: Ben is very broke. He cannot afford rent, so he is going to get a job this month so he won't be evicted. The job he is going to get pays [[P]] per hour, and he works [[H]] hours, and his rent costs [[R]] each month. Output {{YES}} if Ben can afford his rent with extra money, {{NO}} if he cannot afford his rent, and {{BARELY}} if he can afford his rent with no extra money
data.stubGenerator:

read h:int
read r:int
write help broke ben please he doesnt want to become homeless ben
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: an integer [[P]] - the amount Ben earns each hour he works
<<Line 2>>: an integer [[H]] - the number of hours Ben works per month
<<Line 3>>: an integer [[R]] - the monthly rent Ben must pay
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: {{YES}} if Ben can afford his rent with extra money, {{NO}} if he cannot afford his rent, and {{BARELY}} if he can afford his rent with no extra money

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Ben is very broke. He cannot afford rent, so he is going to get a job this month so he won't be evicted. The job he is going to get pays P per hour, and he works H hours, and his rent costs R each month. Output YES if Ben can afford his rent with extra money, NO if he cannot afford his rent, and BARELY if he can afford his rent with no extra money
Input
Line 1: an integer P - the amount Ben earns each hour he works
Line 2: an integer H - the number of hours Ben works per month
Line 3: an integer R - the monthly rent Ben must pay
Output
Line 1: YES if Ben can afford his rent with extra money, NO if he cannot afford his rent, and BARELY if he can afford his rent with no extra money
Constraints
0<P, R, H<1000
Example
Input
20
100
600
Output
YES
